snippet: New defensive initiatives, in Asia and Europe and against Islamic extremists, are bound to upend President Obama’s military budget plans and challenge his military doctrine.
abstract: News analysis; American defense initiatives in Asia, Europe and against Islamic extremists are bound to upend Pres Obama's plans for shrinking the Pentagon's budget before he leaves office in 2017; while bombing campaign against the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria does not match cost of invading and occupying Iraq, weapons and other expenses of taking on ISIS are running up bills of about $225 million per month, figure that will rise if fight is taken into Syria.
lead_paragraph: New defensive initiatives, in Asia and Europe and against Islamic extremists, are bound to upend President Obama’s military budget plans and challenge his military doctrine.

headline.main: Commitments on Three Fronts Test Obama’s Foreign Policy
headline.print_headline: The Three-Headed Monster Challenging the President’s Foreign Policy
